Stop caring about what will happen. Even I got the same suggestions when I asked such questions. (Ps. I wasnâ€™t as brilliant as you guys.)So, just focus on studies, enjoy them and graspAlthough I didnâ€™t even crack Jee-Mains this year and Iâ€™m not even gonna try it again, all I want to say is:PLEASE, throw every source of distraction away, even Quora. If you really wish to crack JEE Mains with great marks, I donâ€™t care if you wish to get rank 100 or 1, you need to work by yourself buddy!Even I used to surf the Internet for such stupid things during my prep times and I really regretted it later. Stop caring about what will happen. Even I got the same suggestions when I asked such questions. (Ps. I wasnâ€™t as brilliant as you guys.)So, just focus on studies, enjoy them and grasp the concepts as good as you can. Surfing for such answers will only weaken your consistency and waste your time. Every second counts if youâ€™re preparing for an exam like JEE-Mains.Make your vision clear and start studying.I can give few tips:1] First, focus on topics you enjoy solving and make them your strengths.2] Use Internet only for the Online Tests!! Inform your parents to keep a strict eye on you.3] Reveal your mistakes through tests. Just solving doesnâ€™t help at all! Please go through the concepts used there. No need to mug up the solutions at all.4] Forget about what will happen in the future. Remove those random thoughts: If you have enough time, If you can compete the huge crowd, If you will be successful. Success canâ€™t be granted until and unless you take it as a joy, passion and not as worry or a rumor.5] Donâ€™t get confused between books. Pick up a single book for each subject and follow it. Thereâ€™s actually no need to run for different books for different topics at-least if youâ€™re preparing for JEE-Mains.So, Iâ€™m sorry to have wasted your precious time. But please, donâ€™t waste your time again scrolling Quora or anything else. Forget the future or past, reveal your present and work smart as well as hardâ€¦ If you want a plan, you need to develop it yourself because, the planâ€™s gonna be for you and not me or anyone else.So, Best of Luck! I hope this answer helps to all the JEE Mains aspirants for this year and you guys do very well in your coming examsâ€¦:)

Answer: This one is justI guarantee you for the Motivation and Inspiration you will get after reading this whole story.This is a story of a Partial Dropper, a JEE Aspirant who Forgot to Fill the form of JEE Main January Attempt. So here it goes :Starting from my 7th class, my Dad brought this book: I was amazed by its problems and my curiosity in science started growing up.He bought it till the 10th class. In 10th class, I was motivated to be an IITian in the future but at a National Level I was not that talented, I was a Normal student in any school who topsThis one is justI guarantee you for the Motivation and Inspiration you will get after reading this whole story.This is a story of a Partial Dropper, a JEE Aspirant who Forgot to Fill the form of JEE Main January Attempt. So here it goes :Starting from my 7th class, my Dad brought this book: I was amazed by its problems and my curiosity in science started growing up.He bought it till the 10th class. In 10th class, I was motivated to be an IITian in the future but at a National Level I was not that talented, I was a Normal student in any school who tops in his class of 45 students and blasts in Joy.I didn't know how to prepare? should I take admission in the coaching class? (as till 10th class I never had been to any tuition class). There were many doubts. I said to my father that I need to be admitted to a coaching class, even he didn't knew about coaching classes. I just knew that â€œto prepare for JEE one Must go to Kotaâ€, so I said this to Mom and Dad that I need to move to Kota. They once agreed but were equally confused and scared about how he can manage to go there and compete. My Father said, â€œWe will talk laterâ€.So, I was in the 10th class, and around my first sem exams, my father told me that his friend advised him about some coaching class in Pune. I was disappointed because I wanted to move to Kota (Allen) as I only knew Allen at that time. I thought my Father will get me admitted to some shitty coaching classes. I was upset. I asked him the name of the coaching class. He said â€œFIITJEEâ€. I never heard of this name.He said about its selection procedure and Fees reduction scheme through scholarship. I gave the Entrance examination ofI gave my 10th Board exams, went well. Now just after 1 month from the boards FIITJEE started its classes for IITJEE preparation. (From around 19th April 2016)I was enrolled in PINNACLE Program IITJEE (2 year Integrated). It means you go to school and there itself FIITJEE teachers will teach you. The School was approximately 11.5KM from my home. I didn't got any VAN facility because it was very far and the fees it took were huge. So, I decided to go by PMT Bus. I went by BUS (First time alone).On the first day itself, I was late a bit. All students were New to me. The teacher was teaching Set Theory. The school (junior college) was Just a building nothing more. I was not able to cope up with the environment and studies. I felt like leaving it and get back to my good olden school days, where no competition was there.But, as time passed I made many friends and was shining little a bit but not more. I always came in Top 5 in my coaching class. Only one student came 1st in my Whole 2 years journey there. He only, Always, Iâ€™m not joking. I came 2nd many times. Not only in my class but in FIITJEE exams held at a large scale, He even topped there. I made him my Idol for JEE preparation. We were good friends, soon we were more than good. After reshuffling exam a batch of 20 students were separated, I was there in it.Through quora, I read answers written byI learned one thing : (*described below)Now, came my 12th class. Preparation was going really very well, but my performance in the test series was not appreciable. I needed a huge improvement. My family thought he will get a seat in IIT for sure but only needs to improve the rank. Deep down I knew, I needed a huge improvement. I started preparing more and more hard. I revised daily. Also, in 2 years (11th + 12th) I never missed a Single class of coaching. In the last 5 months many students didn't came to class because the syllabus was completed. Some left the hope and started preparing for BITSAT, etc . exams. I was going to class for more 2 months (I SHOULD HAVE NOT GONE). I got less time as going to class in the last months of preparation is a dumb idea. They revise your syllabus but it was not worth it as You need to practice and do SELF-STUDY.I was left with just 2 months, 12th boards were coming next month and then JEE Mains 2018. After Boards (went good), there were just 15 days for JEE Mains 2018. I revised, solved previous year questions. Here comes JEE Mains, I gave the exam, thought I did well. But, I didn't, I got around 10k rank in JEE Main 2018. I was disappointed . Not losing hope, I started the preparation of JEE Advanced 2018. Gave JEE Advanced, I again thought I did well, at least will get a good IIT.I didn't wanted to take a drop. So I decided to take admission through JEE Main. I had an interest in Aerospace. I was getting CS at COEP, Pune through MHT-CET. But, with interest in Aerospace, I took admission in IIEST Shibpur, Howrah, West Bengal in Aerospace Department. At that time I saw a guy in Newspaper who got 36th Rank, he was a partial dropper. He was in Punjab Engineering College, Chandigarh in the metallurgical and materials department before. I thought, should I go for this idea? (I went to Howrah from Pune (2000+ KM). I got admitted there. I went to the hostel (First time) and was scared, how could I live here and many thoughts came. Days went, I liked the college. Studied for Mid-Sem and End-sem examinations. I took participation in the events. I was living a great life there.One senior asked me â€œWhy you came here, that to from pune?â€I said â€œ I have a great interest in Aerospaceâ€He laughed like hell. He said â€œI was also like you in the first yearâ€.He then went from there leaving me blind in my thoughts. Mid-Sem exams were about to come. I ignored this incident and focused on studies. I was again in the flow of college life. It was 30th September (Last day applying for JEE Main January Attempt 2019).After some days past, I got to knew the reality of my Department in this college. Information about its condition, placements, and gathered all the info but I managed to live there, after all I am a student of that college. I was scared, because I wanted to study for JEE but havenâ€™t studied not even a single letter. It was in December 2018, after End-Sem exams, it was winter break. I came to Pune. My father asked howâ€™s preparation going on for JEE. I said the truth. I said I will not prepare, I will study aerospace there and I am fine. My father said this â€œI know you are not happy, you still have an optionâ€. I thought a bit. I got emotional looking at my father.I remembered the days when I wanted to get admitted in IIT, the sacrifices my whole family did for the previous 2 years of preparation and faith from my mother at the time I took admission in FIITJEE in 2016! I was confused and Emotional + Scared.What to do now?I didâ€™nt studied anything for JEE and forgot what I studied in 2 years back as a gap 7 months was created. I decided to let go this and be at IIEST Shibpur. I went to IIEST-S on 31st Dec 2018 and reached there at night of 1st January 2019 ( Celebrated New Year in plane :)So, I reached my hostel room. 2nd sem was to start from 11th January.I had very less time to decide. I thought a lot. I directly went to Dean Office and said â€œI want to leave this college, how to do thisâ€. He asked â€œWhy?â€. I said due to personal reasons.After a 7-Days procedure,(*IMP Note: In No means I mentioned IIEST is not good college. Itâ€™s a good College, but yes One must see the branch he is taking before going there)I came back to home now. Everyone was worried if I could clear JEE now in remaining time because I had not done any significant preparation in college. I had in total 3 Months for JEE Main and 4 Months for JEE Advanced (IITJEE 2019).When I came home, from the same day I started my Preparation for IITJEE 2019. But this time I studied very selectively and in the smartest way possible. I studied only the topics in which I was strong and which covered more than 70% of the syllabus before JEE Advanced 2019.I joined 2 Online Test Series vizI ignored this as I was preparing solely for JEE Advanced 2019. JEE Advanced was postponed because of elections in 2019 by 8 days. I got these 8 â€œGolden daysâ€. I studied & revised to the peak of my level and beyond.You need to make short revision Maps for every Topic like this below (for Schrodinger Eq in Atomic Structure made by me) :On 27th May 2019, JEE Advanced was held. I gave with utmost determination and knowledge.Your Confidence is what matters the MOST.Thank You for reading till here!If you are a JEE Aspirant, All the Best for exams.Thanks for the Upvotes :)For more such content, follow :

Answer: Well, 5 months are about to be completed since I started my preparation, and to be honest, it has beenOn the academic side, I think I am doing fairly well. We've had five tests on Mains Pattern and one on Advanced Pattern - my score usually ranges from 260 - 270 (out of 300 )in Mains level while I scored 256 / 360 in the Advanced pattern one .The most interesting aspect is that these five months have changed me. For the very first time, I am living a disciplined life ( My Mom is particularly amazed). I wake up with a list of tasksWell, 5 months are about to be completed since I started my preparation, and to be honest, it has beenOn the academic side, I think I am doing fairly well. We've had five tests on Mains Pattern and one on Advanced Pattern - my score usually ranges from 260 - 270 (out of 300 )in Mains level while I scored 256 / 360 in the Advanced pattern one .The most interesting aspect is that these five months have changed me. For the very first time, I am living a disciplined life ( My Mom is particularly amazed). I wake up with a list of tasks in mind and sleep at night with satisfaction.Also , I've started valuing time more than ever .My schedule is something like this :4:155:00 - 7:45Doing Physics or Mathematics opens up my mind in the morning . I start with either of them based on what I feel like to do . That is followed by the other in Slot 2 .8:30- 11:0012:00 - 2: 303:00 - 6:307:15- 8:4510:15â€“4:15The time between these slots are breaks for Lunch , Rest (read surfing on Quora) , daily chores etc .I have been following this schedule for the past few months. I have been trying to push myself to do more - however, I am not able to do so as of now ( doesn't matter, I'll keep trying)My Current Laptop Wallpaper .I am currently enrolled in a coaching and also have the Unacademy Plus Subscription which I scarcely use , which I got as a prize for securing 14th Rank in Unacademy Prodigy Test ( they sent me an iPhone too :p?)I am currently using these books as a reference , keeping my coaching material as top priority .MathematicsI am not using those Olympiad books as of now , I solved them mostly in Class 9th and 10th .PhysicsI also received Bukhovstev yesterday but right now , it is in quarantine in my Momâ€™s safe vault . I really like solving Irodov - not because it is considered tough ( I think it's pretty basic ) but because of the pattern of questions .ChemistryPeople initially suggested me to buy N Awasthi and VK Jaiswal but I found Neeraj Kumar's level of questions much better while VJ Sir's book is almost the same level as VKJ but it has PYQs as well . That's why I chose them .And finally , some of myThe packages given in my coaching are really comprehensive . They are usually completed along with the chapter as the teachers give regular homework from them . It may not be a national level institute but believe me , I have seen Allen's and FIITJEE's material and ours have a mixture of questions from all of them .Currently , I have equal likeness for all the three subjects ( though I have special curiosity in Physics ) . I was initially apprehensive for Chemistry but have found it to be interesting as well ( people say I have not yet encountered the real face of Inorganic ) .Iâ€™ve been practicing a lot ( at least thatâ€™s what I think ) . As of now , I find myself able to complete every chapter from material as well as above mentioned books . I have done my packages two to three times and for books and usually practice from one book when the chapter is ongoing and use another one for revision . For example , I did Quadratic equation from Package and Arihant when the chapter just finished and after 2â€“3 weeks , I did my package again and this time , practiced from Vikas Guptaâ€™s Advanced Problems . One more thing , I have been collecting all the used pens .These are the number of pens Iâ€™ve used in past 3â€“4 months . I thought it would be pretty amazing to look at the collection of pens ( signifying hard work ) two years later .I also make regular notes and revise them religiously daily after the classes get over .Inorganic chemistry Notes ( Chemical bonding )Maths and Physics NotebooksI also make short notes for revision .Atomic Structure Short NotesWell! Thatâ€™s it . I wanted to pen down my feelings of what Iâ€™ve learnt till now andThanks For Reading . It would be really helpful if you all could give your valuable suggestions/advice in the commentsEDIT :Iâ€™m thankful for 600+ upvotes. One more thing I wanted to share with you guys was that Iâ€™ve been reading this book that has been constantly motivating me as well as guiding me in my preparation.Itâ€™s written by Anagh Bhaiya (

question: https://www.quora.com/Can-I-get-a-JEE-AIR-top-50-while-I-start-preparing-from-now-and-studying-efficiently-12-hours-per-day-When-will-the-JEE-Mains-2022-be-conducted

Answer: Having secured an AIR of 462 I think I am eligible to write this answer. Assuming that the first attempt will be in the month of January/February 23, so you have approximately 4â€“5 months in hand.Firstly, donâ€™t target a sub-1000 rank considering that you are just starting from scratch. Just like in cars you change gears from 1st to 2nd, to 3rd and so on. Similarly, you should first set your target which you believe is achievable and change your â€œgearsâ€ accordingly. This way you would remain motivated to improve more and more.Preparation phase:First target chapters which require low input and giHaving secured an AIR of 462 I think I am eligible to write this answer. Assuming that the first attempt will be in the month of January/February 23, so you have approximately 4â€“5 months in hand.Firstly, donâ€™t target a sub-1000 rank considering that you are just starting from scratch. Just like in cars you change gears from 1st to 2nd, to 3rd and so on. Similarly, you should first set your target which you believe is achievable and change your â€œgearsâ€ accordingly. This way you would remain motivated to improve more and more.Preparation phase:First target chapters which require low input and give a high output.Some chapters like these are :Phy: Modern Physics, Gravitation, Errors and Instruments, Semiconductors,Communication systems and some topics like Carnot engineChem: metallurgy, surface chemistry, atomic structure etc.Maths: Stats, binomial, mathematical reasoning, coordinate geometry etc.Note: There are many chapters which can be categorized under this type but I have given some examples to explain what I mean.After you are done with this then target chapters with low input low output, high input high output and at the last with high input low output.Mock tests:This is a very crucial phase if you want to get a sub-1000 or a sub-500 finish in jee main. NTA has been conducting mains since 2019 with multiple shifts and there are already around 50â€“60 papers now and I think if you would only give them sincerely and analyse them, you will get to learn and improve a lot. Try to give mocks by recreating the exact exam-like atmosphere.Also, one important tip, try to reduce silly errors in jee mains because they can cost you a lot of marks as well as dip your rank considerably. In my case, silly errors costed me 30 marks which dropped my marks from 290 to 260 :(Ending with a quote: â€œAll the best :)

To secure rank-1 you should have command over all the chapters such that you can do any questions spontaneously.If you are able to finish your practice test in 2:30 hours with maximum possible accuracy then you can say you can secure rank-1. But thatâ€™s near to impossible to achieve in only one year.So letâ€™s do a simple math:90 chapters.2â€“3 on an average to finish 1 chapter with proper practice.That requires 180â€“270 days.FroTo be very honest. To secure rank-1 you should have command over all the chapters such that you can do any questions spontaneously.If you are able to finish your practice test in 2:30 hours with maximum possible accuracy then you can say you can secure rank-1. Manoj is very happy that both of his sons Mahesh and Vipul are doing well in their lives however, he wThe main difference between a genius and an average person; an average person learns while a Genius thinks!! You have to THINK, not just LEARN!!!I will explain the difference between the JEE-Advanced and JEE-Main in Laymanâ€™s language!!Read the following paragraph and answer the questions based on it!Your niece Nisha is a very good cricket player. Her uncle Mahesh and her mother Geeta are good at football and her grandfather Manoj is a very good player of golf. Manoj loves his only grandchild. Manoj is very happy that both of his sons Mahesh and Vipul are doing well in their lives however, he wished his wife was alive to see his second son getting married.JEE-Main Question:(A)	Nisha is very good at golf.(B)	Geeta is very good at cricket.(C)	Manoj is very good at football.(D)	All of theseJEE-Advanced Question:(A)	Vipul, 6(B)	Vipul, 5(C)	Mahesh, 6(D)	Mahesh, 5Conclusion: From the above simple questions, you can easily figure out the difference between JEE-Main and JEE-Advance exams. In JEE -Main, your speed, basic concepts are checked while in JEE-Advanced, your concepts are challenged at an advanced level. For JEE-Advanced, you need to be versatile, change your ways of thinking, challenge your limits on every topic, keep on learning more and discover new insights each topic!!

Answer: Depends on how well you've prepared in the past 2 years specifically ( assuming that you're a fresher). If your scores have been great and consistent in what the past toppers have scored in some major All India Level platform exams, then just relax and go for some light reading and skimming off the texts with a glance of important formulae, topics.If not then odds are highly stacked against you. You can also just relax or study a bit more seriously ( depending on your mood and external factors).I would suggest that you focus on your strengths and ignore what you didn't bother fixing during youDepends on how well you've prepared in the past 2 years specifically ( assuming that you're a fresher). If your scores have been great and consistent in what the past toppers have scored in some major All India Level platform exams, then just relax and go for some light reading and skimming off the texts with a glance of important formulae, topics.If not then odds are highly stacked against you. You can also just relax or study a bit more seriously ( depending on your mood and external factors).I would suggest that you focus on your strengths and ignore what you didn't bother fixing during your JEE preparation.And if you are one of those who had an awakening just when the exam ushers in and is at the threshold of making you miserable because you didn't do anything solid or failed spectacularly in giving yourself a firm footing over the rocky terrains of JEE, then take a chill pill. Save your breath and adrenaline over it. Guilt is strongest when the reality hits you. You want to find solace and you did here on this platform. Then you can pray fervently of either postponment or getting a bit easy questions. If nothing appeals your mind, then you may start off with hitting the books for next attempt. This might save your sanity.Lastly all the best ðŸ‘May mass times acceleration be with you ðŸ”¥ ðŸ’¯

Answer: Consider the shark:Sharks appeared about 420 million years ago, and were already in something like their present form.  In other words, they're among the most ancient body forms on the planet, but were so well-engineered by evolution for what they do, they had little need for much in the way of "improvement".Sharks appeared about 420 million years ago, and were already in something like their present form.  In other words, they're among the most ancient body forms on the planet, but were so well-engineered by evolution for what they do, they had little need for much in the way of "improvement".Also, consider the BrowningThe M1911 is an example of something that was engineered long ago but that meets its requirements so well that it doesn't need much in the way of improvements,The M1911 is an example of something that was engineered long ago but that meets its requirements so well that it doesn't need much in the way of improvements,Consider the shark:Sharks appeared about 420 million years ago, and were already in something like their present form.  In other words, they're among the most ancient body forms on the planet, but were so well-engineered by evolution for what they do, they had little need for much in the way of "improvement".Sharks appeared about 420 million years ago, and were already in something like their present form.  In other words, they're among the most ancient body forms on the planet, but were so well-engineered by evolution for what they do, they had little need for much in the way of "improvement".Also, consider the BrowningThe M1911 is an example of something that was engineered long ago but that meets its requirements so well that it doesn't need much in the way of improvements, and improves only slowly as metallurgy and ammunition improves.The M1911 is an example of something that was engineered long ago but that meets its requirements so well that it doesn't need much in the way of improvements, and improves only slowly as metallurgy and ammunition improves.C is similar to the above.  It is simple, very old, but very well-suited to the tasks for which it is used to the point that with the few improvements that have been made over the years to the language and the tools around it, it is hard to see other languages replacing it - and it is quite possible that it will outlast many far "cooler" and "hipper" languages.And like both the shark and the M1911, C can be quite dangerous to those who don't respect it...

Answer: I expect JavaScript to decline in popularity within the next decade. JavaScript is a much-reviled language and the only reason it continues to be used is because it is currently the only language native to the web browser.However, this will change with WebAssembly (or Wasm). Once it matures and has support for DOM manipulation and garbage collection, watch out. The floodgates will open to a whole plethora of superior native languages for the browser, languages like C#, Go, Haxe, Java, Kotlin, Perl, Pharo, Python, Ruby, Scala, etc. Why would you then remain with JavaScript???The way front-end dI expect JavaScript to decline in popularity within the next decade. JavaScript is a much-reviled language and the only reason it continues to be used is because it is currently the only language native to the web browser.However, this will change with WebAssembly (or Wasm). Once it matures and has support for DOM manipulation and garbage collection, watch out. The floodgates will open to a whole plethora of superior native languages for the browser, languages like C#, Go, Haxe, Java, Kotlin, Perl, Pharo, Python, Ruby, Scala, etc. Why would you then remain with JavaScript???The way front-end development is done with JavaScript is needlessly complicated. The landscape of over-engineered frameworks like Angular and React is a colossal clusterfuck of complications. We can, and will, do better with Wasm-based languages.

Answer: I think programming is going to become significantlyRight now, most programmers have a pretty "batch-oriented" programming process: you write some code, then you run it and see what happens. Or maybe you run some tests. Either way, you have a very distinct edit-run-edit cycle. This is even more pronounced with statically typed languages where typechecking as an action is split from editing code. Again, you write some code and then typecheck it; if you have a type error you fix it and repeat, otherwise you're set.Of course, there are some pretty standard tools that are a bit mI think programming is going to become significantlyRight now, most programmers have a pretty "batch-oriented" programming process: you write some code, then you run it and see what happens. Or maybe you run some tests. Either way, you have a very distinct edit-run-edit cycle. This is even more pronounced with statically typed languages where typechecking as an action is split from editing code. Again, you write some code and then typecheck it; if you have a type error you fix it and repeat, otherwise you're set.Of course, there are some pretty standard tools that are a bit more interactive. A REPL lets you load up some code, run snippets and inspect variables. A debugger lets you go through a computation step by step. An IDE can make error checking inline by highlighting broken code. However, all these are still pretty limited.At first, this is going to be primarily a UI/UX advancement. Bret Victor has a some talks like this, andI've even seen some cool interactive development support in Emacs:However, these tools are still very new. The actual user experience is still being developed, and the backends are still very primitive.Languages will also adapt to be more interactive. Haskell is already going in this direction, especially with "type holes". The idea is simple--instead of writing a part of your program, you can leave a "hole" there; the compiler can then tell you what type itIn the longer run, we'll see more advanced backend logic taking advantage of interactivity. For example, we could incorporate efficient search to interactively fill in parts of algorithms according to assertions. The programmer would guide the search by specifying some constraints, but the actual code would be produced by an algorithm. Consider various applications ofSo, my prediction: we will see a much more interactive programming environment coupled with sophisticated tools on the backend assisting the programmer

There are similar companies out there doing the same as dropbox. But do you use any of them?""No.""Why?""Because they are bad.""Ok. That's what Dropbox wants to solve."So bottomline:Any business idea is a solution to someone's problem out there. Ask them if they are solving it, how they are solving it, and if they would be willing to pThe founder of Dropbox was pitching in front of an investor one day, and the investor asked him: "there are similar companies out there doing the same as dropbox, why should I invest in just another similar company?"His reply: "Yes. There are similar companies out there doing the same as dropbox. But do you use any of them?""No.""Why?""Because they are bad.""Ok. That's what Dropbox wants to solve."So bottomline:Any business idea is a solution to someone's problem out there. Ask them if they are solving it, how they are solving it, and if they would be willing to pay to have it solved.It doesn't matter if it already exists if it can be done better.

Answer: The most common failure idea is the idea of doing multiple ideas at once.  A large number of start-ups are guilty of this.  They take on many loosely tied ideas at once and solve multiple problems at once.  They do an OK job solving many problems rather than a great job solving just one problem.Lack of focus is a great way of doing a lot of cool things but no great things.A start-up should be radically focused on one core thing and everyone in the company should be working on just that one thing.  One should have a clear thesis and everyone should be working towards implementing that thesis.

Answer: I have gotten over 5,000 idea submissions from Quorans and they range from existing ideas in well established markets with minimal improvements to new ideas that open up new frontiers in future markets. There are products as well as services. For high school and college kids they mostly center around service they can provide themselves to drop shipping and e-commerce of items made in China that anyone can do to online platforms supported by ads or an affiliate network.Personally I think all three of these are dead ends. Services you provide make you a slave to the business. If you are not workI have gotten over 5,000 idea submissions from Quorans and they range from existing ideas in well established markets with minimal improvements to new ideas that open up new frontiers in future markets. There are products as well as services. For high school and college kids they mostly center around service they can provide themselves to drop shipping and e-commerce of items made in China that anyone can do to online platforms supported by ads or an affiliate network.Personally I think all three of these are dead ends. Services you provide make you a slave to the business. If you are not working you are not making money. For those dropshipping your product is no different than the other 500 people selling the same product on Amazon. It becomes a race to the bottom on price where margins are so thin you never make money. As to the platform solutions there are only so many apps and platforms people need in their daily lives. There are only so many ad impressions available and it is a zero sum game with no future.The deals that succeed focus on annual recurring revenue ARR and things people need on an ongoing basis. I had a great submission about something you buy just before you die but you only buy it once and at $19.95 you would need millions of people to keep dying and keep buying.So, good luck with the ideas. If you want any feedback on your ideas I am happy to review it for free at

I also want to try starting a marketing agencyâ€¦ or maybe an ed-tech startup?â€He cut me offâ€¦â€œStop it Joel.â€â€œThatâ€™s the worst thing you can do.â€â€œPick one idea and stick to it.â€â€œIf you really want to succeed in this game of entrepreneurship, the key is toMost young entrepreneurs have shiny object syndrome. They jump from one idea to the next, and never stick to something long enough to reap the rewards. To make things worse, they are constantly looking for the next great thing and want to start too many companies at once.And even if they did stick to one idea, most entrepreneurs give up on it as soon as things get hard. A few months go by, and then they move onto the next shiny object. Itâ€™s a never-ending cycle.
